page.title: 27Religion in the Area
page.content:
Scotton Methodist Chapel which is currently part of the Knaresborough Circuit was built in 1825. There are weekly morning services and on the second Sunday of each month the Anglican and Methodist congregations join together worshiping alternate months in each others premises.

On special occasions such as Harvest and Christmas, services are also held in the afternoons and evenings. The minister of the Chapel is also a Governor of Scotton Lingerfield Primary School.
Written by the minister the Rev'd Gillian Robertson (the last Superintendent of the Knaresborough Circuit before it joined with Harrogate to form the Nidd Valley Circuit in 2012)
